byline.contributor: Natalia Ojewska contributed reporting from Lviv, Ukraine.

abstract: Increasing number of Ukrainians fleeing conflict in country's east are finding that they are not welcome in Poland and other European nations; countries, wary of opening their borders to flood of job-hungry immigrants, are rejecting or delaying application for asylum from Ukrainian refugees.
lead_paragraph: Favored destinations in the European Union for Ukrainian asylum-seekers have overwhelmingly rejected their applications, saying that unlike other restive nations, areas of Ukraine remain secure.

headline.main: Ukrainian Migrants Fleeing Conflict Get a Cool Reception in Europe
headline.print_headline: A Cool Reception for Ukrainian Migrants in Europe

snippet: Favored destinations in the European Union for Ukrainian asylum-seekers have overwhelmingly rejected their applications, saying that unlike other restive nations, areas of Ukraine remain secure.
